description.narrative: Newton alumni who are established researchers

The Newton Fund Impact Scheme provide funding to escalate impacts of existing Newton Fund research and innovation partnerships between institutions in partner countries and the UK. Grants are flexible and responsive to in-country needs, allowing partners to establish collaborations on areas linked to country priorities and development needs, and to include relevant non-academic partners (including SMEs/ NGOs).

The Newton Fund builds research and innovation partnerships with countries in Africa, Asia and Latin America to support economic development and social welfare, tackle global challenges and develop talent and careers. Known in Malaysia as the Newton-Ungku Omar Fund and established in 2014, the UK has committed to spending up to £35 million between 2015 and 2021 in support of the Fund, with matched funding provided by the Malaysian government. The Fund supports joint research, innovation and capacity development programmes. The current running programme is Newton Fund Impact Scheme. Our main partner for the Scheme is the Malaysian Industry-Government Group for High Technology (MIGHT).
"

participating-org.narrative: UK - Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy (BEIS)

name.narrative: Newton Malaysia is a national project and is delivered in Kuala Lumpur, covering the entire country.
